verses.roman:
jarāsandhaṁ ghātayitvā
bhīmasenena keśavaḥ
pārthābhyāṁ saṁyutaḥ prāyāt
sahadevena pūjitaḥ

synonyms: jarāsandham—Jarāsandha; ghātayitvā—having had killed; bhīmasenena—by Bhīmasena; keśavaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; pārthābhyam—by the two sons of Pṛthā (Bhīma and Arjuna); saṁyutaḥ—accompanied; prāyāt—He departed; sahadevena—by Sahadeva; pūjitaḥ—worshiped.
translation: Having arranged for Bhīmasena to kill Jarāsandha, Lord Keśava accepted worship from King Sahadeva and then departed with the two sons of Pṛthā.
